intro: Asperula podlechii, commonly known as the Alpine azalea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and rhododendrons. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Asperula podlechii thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and prefers cool, moist environments. It is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats at elevations above 1,500 meters.
